channel.title: iPad stuck on Preparing Update when updating to iOS 5.1
channel.description:
I have an iPad that's stuck on "Preparing Update" when I tried to update it to iOS 5.1. Of course my dad gets pissed when I jailbreak stuff, for a reason I don't know, so I thought why not update it? I already have a JB'd 4S.
Does anyone else have this problem where it gets stuck?

item.title: iPad stuck on Preparing Update when updating to iOS 5.1
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:6, topic:435594”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=538315.msg3938444#msg3938444 date=1331235568]
Your first mistake was buying an apple product.
[/quote]

Uh, what?[/quote]
I dislike how much they limit the freedom of the user. Unless of course you jail break the product which I find ridiculous that you have to “hack” their product to add some personalization to it.

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:7, topic:435594”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=538315.msg3938444#msg3938444 date=1331235568]
Your first mistake was buying an apple product.
[/quote]
Your first mistake is being too much of an Android fanboy. I have an Android tablet (custom ICS rom) and a Android phone (MIUI rom with IPhone theme). iOS devices are really not as bad as people make them out to be. Personally I won’t buy one, but that’s because I know my way around Android to well to give it up. The only thing (that i know of) that Android has over iOS besides that Android is open-source, is the fact Android has a recovery partition you can boot up, just incase things like this happen.

@OP - Give it a while (obviously you have at this point) and see if it works. If it doesn’t work call Apple and see if there is any assistance, although it may cost money to get the firmware re-flashed.[/quote]
I find myself to be a minority and hardly know anybody that likes the Android products. Then again Cincinnati area seems to be behind everyone by 10 years.

Read full topic
item.source: iPad stuck on Preparing Update when updating to iOS 5.1

Your first mistake is being too much of an Android fanboy. I have an Android tablet (custom ICS rom) and a Android phone (MIUI rom with IPhone theme). iOS devices are really not as bad as people make them out to be. Personally I won’t buy one, but that’s because I know my way around Android to well to give it up. The only thing (that i know of) that Android has over iOS besides that Android is open-source, is the fact Android has a recovery partition you can boot up, just incase things like this happen.[/quote]

item.title: iPad stuck on Preparing Update when updating to iOS 5.1
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The Wanderer:

Your first mistake was buying an apple product.

Your first mistake is being too much of an Android fanboy. I have an Android tablet (custom ICS rom) and a Android phone (MIUI rom with IPhone theme). iOS devices are really not as bad as people make them out to be. Personally I won’t buy one, but that’s because I know my way around Android to well to give it up. The only thing (that i know of) that Android has over iOS besides that Android is open-source, is the fact Android has a recovery partition you can boot up, just incase things like this happen.

@OP - Give it a while (obviously you have at this point) and see if it works. If it doesn’t work call Apple and see if there is any assistance, although it may cost money to get the firmware re-flashed.

Read full topic

item.title: iPad stuck on Preparing Update when updating to iOS 5.1
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I recall when my girlfriend and I were updating hers, it took a long time during preparing update. If it takes more than 40 mins to an hour, I’d cancel it, do a factory reset, and then do a full upgrade to the newest version.

Read full topic
